thinking.disposable_income: McKinley Park has a median household income of $70,411, with about 36.4% of households earning less than $50,000. The per capita income of $32,106 suggests moderate disposable income levels, making residents somewhat sensitive to transportation costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the income distribution, many households have limited discretionary spending capacity. Higher sales taxes would impact household budgets, especially for the 36.4% lower-income households who spend a larger portion of their income on necessities
thinking.accessibility: The community shows diverse transportation usage: 51.5% drive alone, 21.7% use transit, and 12.7% carpool. 87.7% of households own at least one vehicle, indicating good car accessibility. The area has decent transit access with over 1/5 of commuters using public transit
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized proposals with lower sales tax (0.5-1.0%) to protect discretionary spending. 2. Favored moderate transit fares ($1.25) to balance transit service quality and affordability. 3. Supported moderate driving fees ($0.50) to reduce congestion while not overly burdening the majority who drive. 4. Considered the significant transit-using population (21.7%) when evaluating transit service quality. 5. Balanced travel time improvements with cost impacts across both driving and transit modes
